Comment: > Centrist here. Voted for Obama and for HRC. Frustrated, sat out last year.   You're part of the reason the country is in the shape it's in now.   >Explain to me how requiring an ID to vote is bad.  There's literal entire books on voter suppression tactics, including requiring ID to vote.   Here's a list to start with.  Start with [ Birchers: How the John Birch Society Radicalized the American Right](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/61398888-birchers?from_search=true&from_srp=true&qid=lrDl2EUqK1&rank=9). This one will introduce you to founding of the modern day republican party, how it became what it is, and why they're deadset on rigging elections so they can rule the US.   Next up, read [Dark Money: The Hidden History of the Billionaires Behind the Rise of the Radical Right.](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/27833494-dark-money). It'll introduce you to the players behind the scenes, who they've bought, how they bought those people, and what they're pushing for in regards to election rigging.   After that, check out [Democracy in Chains: The Deep History of the Radical Right's Stealth Plan for America](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/30011020-democracy-in-chains?from_search=true&from_srp=true&qid=OWq8CZ9lAa&rank=1). That will give you an overall view of what the republicans are doing to further the goals of the John Birch Society and the billionaires funding it all.   Next up, read [Give Us the Ballot: The Modern Struggle for Voting Rights in America](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/22929518-give-us-the-ballot).  It covers how conservatives have fought against voting rights since the reconstruction era up to the modern era.   After that, move on to [One Person, No Vote: How Voter Suppression Is Destroying Our Democracy](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/36711317-one-person-no-vote). It goes into deeper detail on the more modern methods republicans have been using to rig elections in their favor.   Once you've finished that one, move on to [The Scheme: How the Right Wing Used Dark Money to Capture the Supreme Court](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/60199845-the-scheme). This one covers how that dark money was used to capture the supreme court, and force through rulings that were covered in the previous two books.   Once you've got that one down, read [Dollarocracy: How the Money and Media Election Complex is Destroying America](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/12451491-dollarocracy). It gives a play by play on how Citizens United directly effected the 2012 and 2014 elections.   After that, read [Ratf**ked: The True Story Behind The Secret Plan To Steal America's Democracy](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/26889647-ratf-ked?ref=nav_sb_ss_1_4). It goes into great detail on how, in 2012, republicans funded by dark money gerrymandered a large swath of the nation, leading them to flip the house, even winning 60%+ of seats in some states where they barely broke 45% of the votes.   From there, move to [The Court v. The Voters: The Troubling Story of How the Supreme Court Has Undermined Voting Rights](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/198509121-the-court-v-the-voters). It goes into detail on how republicans have used various courts around the country and the Supreme Court itself to chip away at the Civil Rights Act and the Voters Rights Act, leaving both former shells of what they used to be.   After all of those, pick up  [Attack from Within: How Disinformation Is Sabotaging America](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/150065063-attack-from-within). Maybe then you can see how you're falling for republican lies.

Comment: This is the "we're not a democracy we're a republic" debate. Everyone assumes I'm on the conservatives side when I bring up this fact, but like you said the Founders were very hesitant to support the concept of being beholden to the general population. They viewed our modern concept of "democracy" as little more than mob rule. I wish more people appreciated this context like you do and then maybe we could see some fundamental reform of the dozens of issues that poll at over 90% support. Nothing with +90% support would go unaddressed (for generations) in even a slightly democratic system. That should be a huge red flag to anyone supporting the illusion that we live in a democracy.
